intro: Cissampelos perrieri, commonly known as the African moonvine, is a climbing vine native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy, yellow flowers. The plant produces small, green, fleshy fruits that contain seeds. It is often found in moist, shaded areas and is used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both ecological studies and horticultural cultivation.
